feed.title: the Azure Architecture Center
feed.subtitle: Updated articles for the Azure Architecture Center

entry.title: Computer forensics Chain of Custody in Azure
entry.summary: Create an infrastructure and workflow to ensure a valid digital evidence Chain of Custody (CoC) for computer forensics in Azure.

entry.title: Chaos engineering
entry.summary: Chaos engineering fundamentals for improving reliability of a service built on Azure

entry.title: Azure for GCP professionals
entry.summary: Understand the basics of Microsoft Azure accounts, platform, and services. Also learn key similarities and differences between the GCP and Azure platforms. Take advantage of your GCP experience in Azure.

entry.title: GCP to Azure Services Comparison
entry.summary: Understand the differences between specific GCP and Azure services.

entry.title: Security considerations for highly sensitive IaaS apps in Azure
entry.summary: Learn about VM security, encryption, NSGs, DMZs, access control, and other security considerations for highly sensitive IaaS and hybrid apps.

entry.title: API-first SaaS business model
entry.summary: Adapt, evolve, and allow faster innovation to turn opportunities into strategic advantages.

entry.title: Elastic demand handling with AKS
entry.summary: Achieve fast and reliable service quality during seasonal and other high-traffic demand periods

entry.title: Instant IoT data streaming with AKS
entry.summary: Ingest and analyze high volumes of IoT data and generate real-time recommendations

entry.title: Threat indicators for cyber threat intelligence in Azure Sentinel
entry.summary: Import threat indicators, view logs, create rules to generate security alerts and incidents, and visualize threat intelligence data with Azure Sentinel.

entry.title: Auditing, risk, and compliance management
entry.summary: Developers could use knowledge mining to help attorneys quickly identify entities of importance from discovery documents and flag important ideas across documents

entry.title: Business Process Management
entry.summary: In industries where bidding competition is fierce, or when the diagnosis of a problem must be quick or in near real-time, companies can use knowledge mining to avoid costly mistakes

entry.title: Content Research
entry.summary: Knowledge mining with a search index makes it easy for customers and employees to locate what they are looking for faster.

entry.title: Contract Management
entry.summary: Knowledge mining can help organizations to scour thousands of pages of sources to create an accurate bid.

entry.title: Customer Feedback and Analytics
entry.summary: Knowledge mining can help customer support teams quickly find the right answer for a customer inquiry or assess customer sentiment at scale.

entry.title: DevOps in a hybrid environment
entry.summary: The tools provided in Azure allow for the implementation of a DevOps strategy that capably manages both cloud and on-premises environments in tandem.

entry.title: DevSecOps in Azure
entry.summary: DevSecOps involves utilizing security best practices from the beginning of development, shifting the focus on security away from auditing at the end and towards development in the beginning

entry.title: Digital Asset Management
entry.summary: Knowledge mining through a search index makes it easy for end customers and employees to locate what they are looking for faster.

entry.title: Building solutions for high availability using Availability Zones
entry.summary: The Azure Availability Zones construct was developed to provide a software and networking solution to protect against datacenter failures and to provide increased high availability (HA) to our customers.

entry.title: High availability and disaster recovery scenarios for IaaS apps.
entry.summary: Choose among high-availability and disaster recovery options like availability sets, availability zones, and regional DR for deploying IaaS apps to the cloud.

entry.title: Build a CI/CD pipeline for chatbots with ARM templates
entry.summary: Use Azure Pipelines with ARM templates to set up a CI/CD pipeline to Azure App Service and Azure Bot Service for a chatbot app.

entry.title: Overview of the resiliency pillar
entry.summary: Describes the resiliency pillar

entry.title: Controlling IoT devices using a Voice Assistant
entry.summary: Create seamless conversational interfaces with all of your internet-accessible devices—from your connected television or fridge to devices in a connected power plant. By combining Azure Speech Service, Language Understanding Service (LUIS) and Azure Bot Framework, developers can create natural, human-like conversational interfaces to control smart devices.

entry.title: IoT using Cosmos DB
entry.summary: Scale instantly and elastically to accommodate diverse and unpredictable IoT workloads without sacrificing ingestion or query performance.

entry.title: AWS to Azure services comparison
entry.summary: Compare Azure cloud services to Amazon Web Services (AWS) for multicloud solutions or migration to Azure.

entry.title: CI/CD for Azure Web Apps
entry.summary: Azure Web Apps is a fast and simple way to create web apps using ASP.NET, Java, Node.js, or PHP. Deliver value faster to your customers with a continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline that pushes each of your changes automatically to Web Apps.

entry.title: Campaign Optimization with Azure HDInsight Spark Clusters
entry.summary: This solution demonstrates how to build and deploy a machine learning model with Microsoft R Server on Azure HDInsight Spark clusters to recommend actions to maximize the purchase rate of leads targeted by a campaign. This solution enables efficient handling of big data on Spark with Microsoft R Server.

entry.title: CI/CD for Azure VMs
entry.summary: Azure is a world-class cloud for hosting virtual machines running Windows or Linux. Whether you use ASP.NET, Java, Node.js, or PHP to develop applications, you'll need a continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline to push changes to these virtual machines automatically.

entry.title: Custom Mobile Workforce App
entry.summary: Learn how the custom mobile workforce management app architecture is built and implemented with a step-by-step diagram that illustrates the integration of Active Directory, SAP, and Azure App Service.

entry.title: DevTest Image Factory
entry.summary: Create, maintain, and distribute custom images with the DevTest Image Factory, an automated image development and management solution from Azure DevTest Labs.

entry.title: Dev-Test deployment for testing PaaS solutions
entry.summary: This architecture represents how to configure your infrastructure for development and testing of a standard PaaS-style system.

entry.title: HPC Risk Analysis Template – Solution Architecture
entry.summary: Build an HPC risk analysis solution architecture with a step-by-step flowchart from Microsoft Azure that combines CycleCloud, Avere vFXT and Tibco Gridserver.

entry.title: Java CI/CD using Jenkins and Azure Web Apps
entry.summary: Azure App Service is a fast and simple way to create web apps using Java, Node, PHP or ASP.NET, as well as support for custom language runtimes using Docker. A continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline that pushes each of your changes automatically to Azure app services allows you to deliver value faster to your customers.

entry.summary: Securely monitor and control data streamed from Internet-connected devices

entry.summary: Car dealerships, automobile manufacturers and insurance companies can use the capabilities of Cortana Intelligence to gain real-time and predictive insights on vehicle health and driving habits.

entry.summary: Best practices about moving Windows applications to an Azure compute platform without rewriting. This migration uses container support in Azure Service Fabric.
